article.name: How to Convert a Template to a Scope
article.title: How to Convert a Template to a Scope
article.body:
In KCM GRC, the purpose of a template is to hold a set of requirements that you will work toward under a scope. In addition to using the managed templates that KCM offers, you can create custom templates to meet your compliance (or other) objectives. Then, you can create a scope by converting a template to a scope.

Follow the steps below to convert a template to a scope.

  1. From the navigation panel, select Compliance > Templates. 
  2. In the Name column, select a template name to open the template.
  3. From the Template Information area at the top of the page, click the Convert to Scope button.

Once the scope is created, you will be redirected to the View Scope page for your new scope. 

To add a scope description, add tags, or change the evidence settings for the scope, click the Update button in the top-right area of the page. For more information about the evidence settings for a scope, please see the Scope Settings section of our How Can I Limit the Types of Evidence That Users Can Submit? article. 

Note: The scope will inherit the name of the template that it was converted from. To change the name of the scope, click the Update button, and enter a new name.

images.alt:
The image displays the "View Templates" configuration screen within a compliance management system.

**Context and Navigation:**
*   **Screen Title:** View Templates
*   **Breadcrumb:** (Home icon) > Compliance > Template > View Templates
*   **Action Button:** A blue "Create" button is prominently displayed in the upper right corner.

**Data Table Structure and Filtering:**
The primary feature is a sortable data table with filtering capability below the headers:
*   **Columns:** Name, Version, System Template, Requirement Count, and Actions.
*   **Filters:** Search input fields are present under the Name and Version columns. The System Template filter utilizes a search input with a dropdown indicator.

**Displayed Template Data (Partial List):**
The table lists several compliance templates:

| Name | Version | System Template | Requirement Count | Actions |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| ACCSC Self Evaluation | 2015 | $\checkmark$ | 260 | |
| **Critical Security Controls** (Highlighted) | 5 | $\checkmark$ | 20 | |
| FFIEC Cybersecurity Tool | 2015 | $\checkmark$ | 493 | |
| HIPAA | 1.0 | $\checkmark$ | 5025 | |
| NIST SP800-171 (Custom) | Rev. 2 | (Blank) | 20 | [Copy/Duplicate, Edit, Delete icons] |

**Focus Element:**
The template entry for **"Critical Security Controls,"** Version 5, which includes 20 requirements and is marked as a System Template, is visually highlighted by an orange oval. The "Critical Security Controls" template name is presented as a clickable link.
images.context: umn, select a template name to open the template.

images.alt:
This image displays a section of a web application interface dedicated to viewing and managing **Template Information** for a compliance or security standard.

**UI Context and Layout:**
The view is headed by the title "**Template Information**" in large, dark text. The layout is divided into a template details area and an action bar of buttons positioned on the right.

**Template Data Fields (NIST SP800-171):**
The primary information displayed includes the template identification and metadata:
*   **Name:** NIST SP800-171 (Custom)
*   **Version:** Rev. 2
*   **System Template:** No
*   **Tags:** (Empty)
*   **Created At:** April 3, 2020
*   **Updated At:** April 3, 2020
*   **Archived:** No

**Action Bar (Buttons):**
A horizontal group of four action buttons is located in the upper right quadrant:
1.  **Convert to Scope** (Primary Action, Blue/Teal)
2.  **Update** (Standard Action, Blue/Teal)
3.  **Archive** (Standard Action, Blue/Teal)
4.  **Delete** (Destructive Action, Red)

**Annotation:**
The image features an instructional overlay: A solid orange arrow points directly to the "**Convert to Scope**" button, which is further highlighted by a thick orange elliptical border.

This image displays the **"View Scope"** interface for a compliance object identified as **"NIST SP800-171 (Custom)"**.

**Header and Actions:**
The header contains standard breadcrumb navigation (Home > Compliance > Scopes > View) and a group of four action buttons associated with the scope object: **Update** (highlighted in blue, primary action, and circled by an orange arrow), **Clone**, **Archive**, and **Delete** (highlighted in red). Scope metadata indicates it was **Created At: May 18, 2020**.

**Navigation Tabs:**
A secondary navigation bar separates the content into tabs. The **Overview** tab is currently active, alongside accessible sections: Requirements, Controls, Tasks, Evidence, and Members.

**Overview Dashboard Panels:**
The main content area is structured into three informational dashboard panels:

1.  **Scope Self-Assessment:** Displays the status breakdown of compliance requirements. Key metrics show **No Answer: 20**, and zero (0) for the color-coded statuses: Met (Green), Partially Met (Orange), Not Met (Red), and Not Applicable (Blue).
2.  **Scope Health:** Features a donut chart illustrating control task progress, showing **Control Tasks Completed 0%**.
3.  **Control Coverage:** Displays control mapping status: **Requirements with mapped controls: 0** and **Requirements without mapped controls: 20**.
